div.div: School Closure Due to Covid-19 Coronavirus
Snake River School District will be closed March 18-April 20. Please contact your child's teacher(s) for home learning activities.

The Snake River District Office is open for business. However, our lobby is only open for deliveries and only essential staff are on site. All other staff are working remotely. If you require in-person assistance, please call (208) 684-3001 during the hours of 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. Monday through Thursday to schedule an appointment.
Free Grab and Go Meals. For more information click here.
Due to health concerns, Moreland Kindergarten Registration will be postponed until further notice. We will reschedule at a later date and will update this announcement as soon as it is rescheduled.
Washington Federal Save at School Program
Washington Federal Bank helps students and families learn about managing and saving money. Click here to see the flyer for more details.
We need Substitute Bus Drivers ASAP! If you are interested, please call the district office at 208-684-3001. Click here for more information.
Enjoy our Parent Newsletter with Parent Activity Calendars and Parent Pointers. Click here to access.
To apply for free or reduced lunch, click the button for access to the online application.
With addition of the turning lane on Hwy 39, if a bus extends its stop arm, vehicles are required to stop. The turning lane should not be used to pass stopped buses.
E-funds Now Has Mobile Payment Capability for Snake River Schools

div.p: This meeting will be done via teleconference utilizing Zoom. We will be providing a link for you to be able to listen in on the meeting.

Because this is a virtual meeting, if you would like to address the Board during the Patron Forum about an item listed on the agenda, please email your name and comments to the Clerk of the Board at coomteri@snakeriver.org by Monday, 05/18/2020 by 4:30 p.m. Remember that the Board will not hear complaints against personnel or any students. Thank you.

Join Zoom Meeting
Board Meeting May 20, 2020
(The link will be posted the day of the meeting)
Call in information can be found at the bottom of the notice.

div.p: The District serves a family-oriented community that has strong values and high standards. It is an excellent place to raise children. The patrons are very supportive of the schools and insist on a high quality educational program.

Snake River School District is located in the heartland of some of Idaho’s best hunting and fishing, and is surrounded by some of the most scenic and enjoyable recreational areas in the world. It is within easy driving of Yellowstone and Grand Teton National Parks, Jackson Hole, and Sun Valley.

Just 25 miles to the north is Idaho Falls, and 25 miles south is Pocatello, the home of Idaho State University. Close by to the east is the City of Blackfoot, with an excellent golf course. Idaho National Laboratory is 40 miles to the northwest. Nearby Fort Hall provides unique Native American Festivals with arts and crafts available.
With its clean wholesome environment, excellent educational opportunities, and recreational setting, the Snake River School District is an excellent place to live.

ul.li: The Snake River School/Community Library serves the school district and community with wide circulation, access to research capabilities, satellite technology, FAX service, and access to inter-library loan to unlimited resources.
The Snake River School Educational Foundation assists the District in providing the highest quality of educational programs and facilities.
School Board Meetings are open to the public and are held on the 3rd Wednesday of each month at 7 pm in the board room of the District administrative offices.
An eight hundred seat auditorium provides seating for stage performances.
